alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 3:09AM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. Ice accumulations a quarter to a half of an inch. North to northeast winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central Willamette Valley. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest ice accumulations expected east of the I-5 corridor, while the heaviest snow accumulations will be to the west closer to the Coast Range.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
